
### why lifetimes? (1)  {.smaller}


```rust
let x = vec![1, 2, 3, 4];
let mut q = &x[1];
{
    let mut r = &x[1];
    let y = vec![5, 6, 7, 8];
    if random() == 0 {
        r = &y[1]; // SHOULD BE FINE
        q = &y[1]; // SHOULD BE ERROR
    }
    println!("{}", *r);
}
println!("{}", *q);

```
 

* need to prevent <code>q</code> referring to values that live too long


### why lifetimes? (2)  {.smaller}


```rust
fn mystery(ptr: &i32, vec: &Vec<i32>) -> &i32 {...}

fn example() {
    ...
    let mut x = vec![1, 2, 3, 4];
    let mut q = &x[1];
    {
        let mut y = vec![5, 6, 7, 8];
        q = mystery(q, &y);
    }
    println!("{}", *q);
}

```
 

* question: should assignment to be q from mystery be allowed?
